Setting Semaphore Options

To perform this procedure, you must first select the project database or project you want to configure. The project database or project must also be associated with a configuration file.

To set semaphore options:

  1. Select Admin | Configure Project. The Configure Project dialog box appears with the General tab active.

  2. Select Semaphores beneath Miscellaneous. The Semaphores pane on the right appears. The values that display for each option are the settings that are currently defined in the configuration file associated with the project database or project.

  3. In the Semaphore Directory group, you can either:

    • Select Archive Directory to place the semaphore files in each archive directory.
    • Select Other Directory and specify the path of the directory to place the semaphore files in a directory other than the archive directory.

  4. Specify the suffix template for semaphore files. The default suffix is +-sem, which causes Version Manager to add the characters -sem to the end of the archive filename. For example, if the archive file name is windev.c_v, the semaphore file is windev.c_v-sem.

  5. In the Number of Retries field, specify how many attempts Version Manager will make to gain exclusive access to an archive or journal file in networked environments.

  6. In the Retry Delay field, specify the delay (in seconds) between attempts to gain exclusive access to archives, journal files, and the access control database.

  7. Click OK if you are finished defining options, or click Apply to save the settings and continue to define other options.
